title: Software & Security Engineer, Internal Operations
description:
Are you an analytical problem-solver with a passion for programming, infrastructure, and IT security? Do you want to put your skills to real use and make a difference in society through technology? We are now looking for a Software & Security Engineer to join or Internal Operations department.
  
  

Sectra is one of the world’s leading providers of IT systems for managing medical images. Our long-term ambition is to be the leader in making customers’ diagnostics more efficient and contribute to proven improved care outcomes for patients. In other words - we create future-proof and effective solutions that help save lives.
  
  

Working as an engineer in Internal Operations
  
  

You will work in one of the teams focused on internal engineering and efficiency, paving the way for the rest of the development organization.
  
  

The team's responsibilities include CI/CD environments, automation, tools, security and system administration. Together as a department we create software that helps millions of patients worldwide.
  
  

Our teams are organized into agile, self-organized groups with a shared passion for technology. The team is responsible for both the design, implementation, and quality of our services. Your main responsibilities will most likely include:
  
  

Writing code to manage and maintain development infrastructure, servers and tools.
  
Solving complex and interesting problems.
  
Working with modern tools and solutions. We are currently adopting automation and cloud solutions in many areas.
  
Continuously improving our development, test and continuous integration environments.
  
Be part of a team with joint responsibility for delivery, working in close cooperation with stakeholders.
  
Evolving our way of working – we can always make things better!
  
Work with great people
  
SOFIA ADOLFSSON
  
UX Designer
  
"There is no sense of prestige at Sectra, no hierarchy. Everyone is listened to regardless of their position."
  
ADAM ALSEGÅRD
  
Software Engineer
  
"I believe Sectra is a great company, with the possibility for personal growth."
  
Skills & Requirements
  
  

At Sectra, we hire for attitude and ability – train for skill. This means who you are is more important than your previous experiences. There are a few core abilities that are central for any role. We always look for your willingness and ability to learn and take on new tasks fast, utilize previous experiences and quickly grasp new information. We also want you to have a strong analytical mindset in which we consider it to be important that you can understand and break down and solve problems. We also look for good communicators who have the ability to interact with colleagues, partners and customers in an effective, clear and constructive way.
  
  

**In addition to these abilities, we also want you to:**  

Have a Bachelor’s or master’s degree within engineering, IT or similar with a strong academic record
  
Have a strong interest in programming, IT security, server infrastructure and networking.
  
Have an interest in new and innovative technology and software development.
  
Value development efficiency and thrive in a fast-paced technological environment.
  
Be fluent in Swedish and English, both verbally and written.
  
  

**We consider it a great asset if you:**  

Have experience in software development using agile methods
  
Speak more languages than those required above
  
Have interests besides school and work; Such as sports, music, board games, computer games, singing or flying.
  
  

**Other information:**  

The goal is for the right candidate to start as soon as possible.
  
  

We recruit on an ongoing basis. This means we encourage you to apply or contact us as soon as possible.
  
  

Great Place to Work
  
  

Making a difference
  
  

Great colleagues
  
  

Personal development
  
  

Innovation & technology
  
  

Global environment
  
  

Working close to customers
  
  

About the company
  
  

Sectra develops and sells cutting-edge solutions for medical IT and cybersecurity. We help hospitals and those who are training future healthcare personnel to improve their efficiency so that patients can receive better care. We also support and help defense, authorities, and critical social functions to secure their communication against eavesdropping and protect their systems against unauthorized access. This is how we create conditions for a healthier and safer society.
  
  

One thing that identifies us at Sectra is our customer obsession— our ability and willingness to understand, create value for and stand up for our customers. This shared priority is at the core of our culture. Our customers describe this as having the knowledge to meet expectations, the passion to exceed them. As we hire for attitude and ability - train for skill, we happily expand your knowledge, if you bring the passion and willingness to learn.
  
  

Stefan Doverud | Contact Person
company_description: The company was founded in 1978, has its head office in Linköping with subsidiaries in 19 countries and operates through partners worldwide.

title: User Experience Designer
description:
Overview


Application


 **Ignite the Future of Education as a User Experience Designer at Kognity** 
Are you passionate about revolutionizing education? Do you have a talent for creating delightful user experiences? Join us at Kognity and be a driving force behind the evolution of education as our next User Experience Designer.

**Why Kognity is the place to be:**

* ✨ **Educational Innovation**: Be a part of a trailblazing EdTech company committed to reshaping the future of learning. Your designs will directly contribute to creating impactful solutions that enhance the educational experience for teachers and students.
* ✨ **User-Centric Approach**: Your work will empower educators, engage students, and make a lasting impact on the education landscape.
* ✨ **Collaborative Culture**: Work alongside a passionate team of Designers, Engineers and Product Managers, dedicated to leveraging technology to radically improve learning.
* ✨ **Career Growth**: Seize the chance to grow professionally in a dynamic environment. We invest in our team members' development, providing resources and opportunities for continuous learning and advancement.

**Responsibilities:**

* Design and deliver seamless user experiences by driving the end-to-end design flow (Discovery, Solution Design and Evaluation.)
* ‍ Play a key role in revolutionizing our design function; Design system, Information Architecture, metrics, Content & Typography guidelines, and Design principles.
* Conduct research to truly understand our users and inform wider product decisions; interviewing, prototyping, workshops, and validation.

**Requirements:**

* A track record of successfully designing and delivering customer-facing digital products.
* UX research experience; Proficiency in user research techniques, qualitative/quantitative data, user testing, interviewing and consolidating.
* Visual & Interaction Design; Experience using typography, icons, illustrations, buttons, colours, and layouts to create visually appealing interfaces.
 ‍
* Technical Skills: You’ll need to be well-versed in UX tools and technologies; examples include Figma, MixPanel, HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.

**Interview process**

* **Discovery Call with a Recruiter**: A friendly chat with a Recruiter to explore if the role is your perfect match.
* **Hiring manager discussion** - a talk with the VP of Product and Design to discuss the role in more detail.
* **Portfolio discussion**: A 30-minute discussion based on two of your recent projects with our design team.
* **Case study collab**: A 90-minute collaborative design task with the team.
* **Values Interview**: Share your journey by engaging in a lively discussion about your experiences, aligning them with the heartbeat of our company values.

**Our Values**

* **We maximise progress** - We're not just dreamers; we're doers! We dive deep, reflect, and craft strategies that propel us toward our vision. If it means maximum progress, we make it happen, no holding back!
* **We take ownership** - We take initiative and solve problems we see.
* **We drive customer value** - Success for our customers drives our progress. We create customer value in everything we do.
* **️ We are transparent** - No secrets, no mysteries. We're the open book of opinions and feedback. Radical transparency is our thing, and we're not shy about sharing information far and wide. Let the truth shine!
* **We take care of ourselves and each other** - We work hard and passionately. We also prioritise our well-being and that of our colleagues. We think long-term.

**Benefits**

* Flexible working; Work in a way that fits around your personal life.
* Truly Hybrid — work from anywhere in Sweden or our Stockholm office.
* Home office allowance of 5,000 SEK to create a comfortable remote work environment.
* ITP Pension Plan with Nordnet
* Yearly budget of 5,000 SEK to spend on health-related services.
* Learning and Development budget of 4,000 SEK every year.
* 30 days of paid vacation every year
* Full pay sick leave starting on day 1
* MacBook, iPhone as work equipment

**Every qualified person will be evaluated regardless of age, gender, identity, nationality, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status or religion.**


See more about how we collect and process your personal data in our Privacy Notice.


  
Location


Sweden
Type


Full time
Department


Product
company_description: Kognity is one the fastest growing EdTech companies in the world and we aim to radically improve learning for 1.5 billion school students globally.

title: User Experience Designer | Inter IKEA Data & Technology Range
description:
**Job ID:** R0009994


**Date posted:** 28/11/2024


**A day with us!**

  

Calling all UX designers with a passion for designing innovative customer experiences that make people feel right at home. Do you have a visionary mindset with a playful spirit and a love for collaboration? Then, it’s a match!


We’re on the lookout for UX Designers who are curious and natural talents in systematic thinking. Your ability to work in a collaborative environment and jump into existing product processes is just as important as your UX design skills, so bring your teamwork A-game!


As a UX Designer in Range, you'll be working alongside some of the world's most talented designers, engineers, and product managers, influencing product decisions in a data and user-centric approach and translating the IKEA vision into reality through your UX design contributions. You'll be a strategic thinker, always looking at the big picture, while also paying attention to every detail to ensure we're delivering quality and intuitive digital experiences for our customers of all levels of use.


You will be joining a team that lives and breathes collaboration! We love to bounce ideas off one another and build on each other's strengths to create even better products.


In this role, you will:

* Support UX Manager in creating future UX Strategies and create aspirational concepts for the future of user experience
* Use early prototyping and research as everyday tools to refine the experiences
* Challenge existing solutions by driving meaningful innovation and creativity throughout the development.
* Encourage stakeholders to prioritize solutions that are beneficial for the user, the society, and the planet

  

**Qualification**  

These are our wishes:

* 5+ years of experience as a designer working on innovative digital solutions, familiar with modern digital and physical product development processes
* Skilled in storytelling, user flows, wireframing, and usability with an ability to make complicated technology friendly to many people.
* Have a university-level education in the areas of Interaction Design, Industrial Design, or Software Engineering.
* Previous IKEA experience will be a plus

  

**More Information**  

This is a full-time position based in Malmö, with occasional travel to Älmhult as required for business needs. We are actively conducting ongoing interviews, so we encourage you to submit your application without hesitation, The last date for application is 11th Dec.


Please be aware that our recruitment process may experience some delays during the upcoming holiday season.Questions about the recruitment process can be answered by Aorui via aorui.pu1@inter.ikea.com

*About Inter IKEA Group*

*Inter IKEA Group is the group of companies that connects IKEA franchisees with range development and suppliers and aligns the overall IKEA strategic direction. All to create a better everyday life for the many people. The Group includes Inter IKEA Systems B.V. – the worldwide IKEA franchisor – as well as range development, Supply and certain industry activities.*
company_description: At IKEA, we share an inspiring vision: “to create a better everyday life for the many people”.

title: SEM-Specialist till SiteSmart
description:
På SiteSmart hjälper vi företag att förbättra sina affärer online. Vår innovativa e-handelsplattform är snabb, mångsidig och enkel att använda och möjliggör för e-handlare att arbeta effektivt med innehåll.


Brinner du för digital marknadsföring och vill vara med och skapa framgångsrika kampanjer som verkligen gör skillnad för våra kunder? Vi söker nu en **SEM-specialist** som vill hjälpa företag att växa genom strategiskt och datadrivet arbete med sökmotormarknadsföring.


**Om rollen**
  

Som SEM-specialist hos oss kommer du att:


* Planera, skapa och optimera Google Ads-kampanjer för våra kunder, med fokus på att maximera ROI och öka konverteringar.
* Analysera och utvärdera kampanjdata för att utveckla och förbättra strategier.
* Arbeta nära våra kunder för att förstå deras behov, mål och målgrupper, och omsätta det i effektiva annonseringslösningar.
* Hjälpa våra kunder att kombinera skapa en helhetsstrategi som kombinerar SEO, SEM och UX för bästa möjliga resultat.
* Hålla dig uppdaterad om nya trender och teknologier inom digital annonsering för att säkerställa att vi alltid erbjuder våra kunder det senaste och bästa.

**Vem är du?**
  

Vi tror att du har:


* En utbildning inom marknadsföring, digital kommunikation, grafisk design eller liknande.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med Google Ads, inklusive sök-, Performance Max och Meta annonsering.
* En stark analytisk förmåga och erfarenhet av att arbeta med data för att fatta strategiska beslut.
* God förståelse för SEM och dess samverkan med SEO.
* Ett intresse för digital marknadsföring och en vilja att hjälpa företag att nå nya höjder.
* Meriterande om du har erfarenhet av andra annonseringsplattformar, t.ex. TikTok, eller certifieringar inom Google Ads.

Som person är du initiativrik, resultatinriktad och har ett öga för detaljer. Du är en lagspelare som trivs i en miljö där vi samarbetar för att ge våra kunder den bästa möjliga upplevelsen.


**Vårt erbjudande**


* Flexibel arbetsmiljö som möjliggör att enklare kunna kombinera jobb och familjeliv.
* Moderna molnbaserade system och digital teknik.
* Möjlighet att arbeta med spännande och varierande projekt inom olika branscher.
* Konkurrenskraftiga villkor med bra pensions- och försäkringssystem samt friskvård och övriga förmåner.

**Om Sitesmart**
  

SiteSmart är sedan 2023 en del av VIEW Group. Vi utvecklar e-handelsplattformen SitesSmart och erbjuder kompletta tjänster inom sökmotoroptimering, onlinemarknadsföring och användarupplevelse. Bland våra kunder finns både små och stora verksamheter som erbjuder onlineförsäljning B2C och B2B. Vi är idag 7 medarbetare som sitter tillsammans på vårt kontor i Motala. Med olika bakgrund och erfarenheter blir det en god stämning på arbetet och vi bidrar alla till en utvecklande kultur där vi delar med oss av våra kunskaper till varandra. Hos oss blir du del av ett innovativt och teknikdrivet företag, där fokus ligger på att utvecklas och ha roligt tillsammans!


*SiteSmart arbetar efter en kompetensbaserad rekryteringsmodell där arbetspsykologiska tester förekommer som en del av bedömningen. På slutkandidat görs även bakgrundskontroll.*

Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Senior UX/UI Designer
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.

 **Jobbeskrivning**  

I rollen som UX/UI Designer kommer du exempelvis att arbeta med gränssnitt mellan olika grupper för att skapa lättillgängliga och användarvänliga system. Du kommer ingå i ett team med skickliga kollegor där samarbete och kompetensutbyte premieras. Här kommer du ges stort eget ansvar och frihet att lägga upp ditt arbete.


Som person söker vi dig som besitter god logisk förmåga och ett lösningsorienterat arbetssätt. Vidare är du driven, får saker att hända och har god kommunikativ förmåga.  

  

**Din profil (Skall krav)**

  

* Högskoleutbildning inom design, alt motsvarande erfarenhet
* 5 års erfarenhet som UX/UI Designer
* Erfarenhet av research, prototyparbete, visualisering och användargränssnitt
* Kunskaper kring interaktion mellan människa och teknik
* Flytande i svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift

  

**Sista ansökningdatum:** 06-12-2024  

  

**Om Deploja**  

Vi sysselsätter idag erfarna konsulter, inom bl.a. Systemutveckling, Test, Arkitektur, IT-Projektledning, IT-Säkerhet.  

  

Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?

  

Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Välkommen till Deploja, där gräset faktiskt är grönare!

 **Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**


Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.


En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.


Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.


Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.


Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?


Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.

  

Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.


Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?

 *Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.*

title: Digital Product Designer
description:
We help world leading brands and ambitious disruptors shape, ship and scale digital products and experiences.


We shape visions, strategies, business cases, roadmaps, requirements, plans and prototypes. All with a highly collaborative and facilitative approach, in deep partnership with our clients.


We ship prototypes and product releases, by testing and learning, iterating and innovating, all in the pursuit of product success. Our deep experience and quality of craft focuses our work on what truly matters.


We scale products, driving remarkable client outcomes throughout the product lifecycle, regionally and globally. We do this with an obsessive focus on speed, simplicity, quality and cost-effectiveness.


We are a part of Eidra, a group of companies specializing in strategy, creativity, innovation and engineering. As a collective we guide leaders in making meaningful and lasting change.

 **What You’ll Do**

* Create valuable, beautiful, and implementable UX/UI design driven by data and research.
* Drive design deliveries independently or within cross-functional teams.
* Work with design systems to maintain consistency across platforms.
* Engage directly with stakeholders to align on project goals and outcomes.
* Foster a positive work environment and design culture by mentoring junior designers and sharing expertise.
* Take ownership of design processes, from brief to final delivery.

 **What We’re Looking For**

* Proven experience in digital product design, creating impactful user experiences with a strong UI focus and attention to detail.
* A solid portfolio demonstrating your craft.
* Skilled in Figma, with a solid understanding of creating and maintaining design systems.
* Strong experience in making your designs implementable and aligned with platform and developer needs.
* Able to clearly articulate design rationale, connecting decisions to user needs, business goals, and technical constraints.
* Fluent in English, with good working proficiency in Swedish.

 **As a colleague, you are:**

* Proactive: You take initiative and handle tasks independently.
* Solution-oriented: You tackle challenges with a positive, service-minded approach.
* Team player: You thrive in collaborative environments and value collective success.
* Impact-focused: You aim to create meaningful results beyond just high-quality work.


This role offers the opportunity to work on high-impact projects, collaborating with a multidisciplinary team to deliver digital products for global brands.

 **Portfolio required: Applications without a portfolio will not be reviewed.**

title: E-commerce intern
company_industry: Retail Health and Personal Care Products
description:
**About Us** 

 Supernormal™ är ett innovativt Health-tech och E-commerce-företag som kombinerar avancerad teknik och personligt stöd för att hjälpa människor nå sina hälsomål. Vi befinner oss just nu mitt i en transformation och ska migrera vår e-handelsplattform till en ny, toppmodern lösning.
 



  





 Nu söker vi en engagerad praktikant som vill vara en del av detta strategiskt viktiga projekt. Detta är en unik möjlighet att få praktisk erfarenhet av digital transformation inom e-handel och bidra till att förbättra kundupplevelsen och driva vår tillväxt.
 



  




**Om Praktiken** 

 Som E-Commerce Intern kommer du att arbeta nära vår
 **Head of E-Commerce** 
 och delta i ett projekt som är centralt för vår fortsatta framgång. Rollen ger dig praktisk erfarenhet av att arbeta med e-handel, projektledning och digitala verktyg i en dynamisk agil start-up miljö.
 



  




**Vad du kommer att göra** 
* **Innehållshantering:** 
 Assistera med att optimera och uppdatera innehåll på vår e-handelsplattform för att förbättra användarupplevelsen.
* **Datamigrering:** 
 Delta i planering och utförande av datamigrering från den nuvarande plattformen till den nya, med fokus på kvalitet och precision.
* **Projektstöd:** 
 Stödja implementeringen av nya funktioner och integrationer, inklusive betalnings- och logistiklösningar.
* **Marknadsanalys:** 
 Genomföra konkurrent- och marknadsanalyser för att identifiera förbättringsmöjligheter.
* **Kundresan:** 
 Bidra till att utveckla och förbättra kundresan genom UX/UI-förbättringar och testning.



  





  




**Din Profil** 

 Vi söker dig som har:
 


* En pågående eller nyligen avslutad utbildning inom e-handel/ecommerce, marknadsföring, IT.
* Stark kommunikativ förmåga på svenska och engelska.
* God organisatorisk förmåga och en detaljorienterad inställning.
* Intresse för e-handel och digitala verktyg. Erfarenhet av e-handelsplattformar eller datamigrering är meriterande.
* En positiv attityd, lösningsorienterat tänkande och en vilja att lära dig.



  




**Vad vi erbjuder** 
* **Praktisk erfarenhet:** 
 Få ovärderlig erfarenhet inom e-handel och projektledning.
* **Utveckling:** 
 Arbeta med en modern teknologisk transformation och lär dig om aktuella trender och lösningar inom e-handel.
* **Mentorskap:** 
 Dagligt stöd från vår Head of E-Commerce, med möjlighet att utvecklas i en stödjande miljö.
* **Flexibilitet:** 
 Praktiken sker på plats i Stockholm, med möjlighet att styra och prioritera uppgifter självständigt.
* **Övrigt:** 
 En unik insyn i ett snabbväxande bolag på en spännande marknad.



  




**Viktig information** 

 Praktiken är
 **obetalad** 
 och bör vara en del av din pågående utbildning eller kurs.
 



  





 I din ansökan, inkludera följande:
 


* Din utbildning och hur praktiken är kopplad till denna.
* Om praktiken ingår i ett utbildningsprojekt.
* Varför du vill göra din praktik hos Supernormal™.



  




**Ansökan** 

 Vi tar emot ansökningar fram till
 **15 december 2024** 
 , men urval och intervjuer sker löpande. Skicka ditt CV och personliga brev till Fabian@supernormal.health
 



  





**Om Supernormal™** 




 Supernormal™ är ett snabbt växande svenskt Health-tech-företag med målet att förbättra människors hälsa genom innovativa produkter och tjänster. Läs mer om oss på https://supernormal.health/se/.
 



  





 Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!

title: Change Manager
description:
Grow with us
   

  

**About This Opportunity**
 We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Change/Transformation Manager for Product Lifecycle Management. The Change Manager will be responsible to identify and implement change management activities related to the Product Lifecycle Management process, ensuring smooth transitions with minimal service disruptions. This role will focus on maintaining high standards of quality and compliance while working closely with technical, operational, and business teams.
   

  

 What you will bring:
   

  

* Strategic Change Leadership:
* Work within a cross functional, multi disciplinary team to drive necessary changes and uptake of Product Lifecycle Changes and Tools throughout our Sell, Develop and Deliver processes.
* Lead change management efforts to facilitate the smooth adoption of new processes and technologies, identifying and managing anticipated resistance to change.
* Internal Optimization:
* Implement best practices to reduce the time and cost of change implementation while enhancing overall service quality.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams ensuring that all necessary approvals and requirements are met to drive change.
* Communication for Impact:
* Communicate with impact to drive necessary transformation both internally and externally towards our key stakeholders.
* Risk Management:
* Assess and Manage the impact, risk, and scope of product and process introduction and changes throughout our product lifecycle.
* Where necessary Ensure risk assessments are conducted for all changes and contingency plans are in place.
* Performance Analytics:
* Analyze and design fit-for-purpose change management metrics and KPI’s to identify areas for process improvements.


 Join our Team
   

  

 Your Skill set;
   

  

* Excellent communication and leadership skills to interact with technical teams, business stakeholders, and customers.
* Strong Stakeholder management skills.
* Strategic attitude with a keen curiosity about finding opportunities, mitigating risks, and navigating sophisticated organizational landscapes.
* Strong understanding of Ericsson Product Development and Management and EGMS ways of working, tooling and processes.
* Strong analytical foresight, demonstrating data and metrics to drive performance optimization and informed decision-making.
* Strong strategic and analytical skills to assess dependencies, risks and impacts of changes.
* Experience in change management roles, and knowledge of organizational change methodologies.
* Experience working with Internal Communications in a big organization, communication for impact.
* E2E thinking, within the Ericsson ways of working of Sell, Develop and Deliver, knowledge of both Hardware and Software flows would be considered an asset.
* Experience of working with UX and UX design for ease of uptake of new tools and ways of working would be considered an asset
* Knowledge of Security/Privacy would be considered an asset.

title: Machine Learning Engineer
description:
We are looking for a dynamic and innovative
 **Machine Learning Engineer** 
 to join our team. This role is ideal for someone who thrives in a startup environment and is passionate about developing cutting-edge AI solutions. As a Machine Learning Engineer, you will work collaboratively with cross-functional teams to drive our AI initiatives forward.
   

  

**Company Description**
 Hypertype is an AI-powered text based communication platform that finds the most relevant information and writes smarter customer emails & live chats, using real-time company data.
   

  

 305 billion emails sent and received every single day. We live in an information overload era, with ever-changing customer scenarios to process and answer. Customer facing roles still spend 20-30 mins just to find the right answers and draft high quality email, connecting the dots from millions of data sitting inside their company. Our vision is to make the smartest experience for customer communications with data.
   

  

 Only a single digit % of SMEs has adopted AI in their customer facing teams. We have over 200 paying companies including Mynt, Yazen, Remote and many more.
   

  

 Our customers proudly recognize us for delivering the "highest quality answers in the market... outsmarting Gemini, Fin, Microsoft Copilot etc". —a testament to our unwavering commitment to excellence and precision in every interaction.
   

  

 Join us on our mission to build the world’s smartest and most accurate AI brain across customer domains and beyond. If you're driven and ready to contribute to something groundbreaking, this is your chance to be part of a mission that is setting new industry standards.
   

  

**The Position**
 The
 **ML Engineer** 
 is responsible for
 **developing Hyperbrain AI** 
 to build the world's smartest and accurate brain for CS and many more domains. Hyperbrain ingests and stores high quality data which is unique for each company. Company data is ingested from omni- data sources into Hyperbrain in one-click. Hyperbrain then automatically writes customer communications with the most relevant data in the reply interfaces e.g. Intercom, Gmail and Outlook, to answer trillions of customer scenarios that is beyond standard Chatbot conversations.
   

  

 In the role, you will design, develop, and deploy machine learning models that directly impact Hypertype products. You will work closely with customer data, ensuring the models are not only accurate and efficient but also compliant with data privacy regulations.
   

  

* Developing new product experiences using NLP & LLMs and working closely with customers to understand their needs and ensure successful implementation.
* Implementing and shipping state-of-the-art information retrieval systems and search algorithms, with high impact metrics
* Improve the quality and accuracy of answers from omni- data sources and format, by incorporating the best data and features to improve AI suggested answers.
* Prompt engineering and fine-tuning to improve the quality of customer communications for different scenarios.
* Collaborating with cross-functional teams to align technical decisions with business goals and co-develop ML roadmap.
* Designing, developing, and maintaining scalable APIs for integrating new data sources.
* Collaborate with frontend developers to ensure APIs are efficient, well-documented, and deliver the necessary data for UI/UX components.
* Troubleshooting and resolving data-related issues, ensuring continuous data flow and minimal downtime.
* Identifying opportunities for performance improvements and proactively implementing solutions to improve the data architecture.
* Rapidly integrating new data sources to support POCs and MVPs, working closely with co-founders and the sales team to offer technical expertise throughout the sales process.


**Qualification**
* You have ample experience in in building machine learning pipelines and / or information retrieval systems and are up to speed on latest in NLP & LLMs.
* You have experience in developing POC and MVP to facilitate the successful establishment of customer partnerships and the closing of deals.
* You have applied knowledge of A/B testing for model evaluation
* Versatile Software Engineering Skills: A solid engineering background with a robust foundation in software engineering principles. You have written code for and supported production engineering systems.
* Proficient in Python and experience with GCP: our AI stack uses Python, Hugging Face, PyTorch & Elasticsearch and is deployed on GKE.
* You care about delivering true business value and solving RAG challenges at the same time.
* A Solid Educational Foundation: Bachelor’s degree in Machine Learning, Computer Science or related field; Master’s degree is a plus.


**Bonus points**
* Experience with ETL processes, data pipelines and large-scale data processing.
* Familiar with tools like Airbyte, Apache Airflow, or similar.
* Experience with Node and Typescript.
* Familiar with data security and compliance (e.g., PII handling, ISO 27001, SOC 2, GDPR). Familiarity with the Vanta platform is a strong plus.


**The Offer**
* Opportunity to be part in a generative AI startup before the next AI inflection point.
* A role and position that enables you to be part of building and shaping the way how customer information is shared and communicated.
* Take part of our journey as we grow to be at the forefront to solve AI challenges and work towards building Hyperbrain AI for every domain for a decision-making AI.
* Salary + Equity + Opportunity to grow in the role


 At Hypertype, we look for positive, 'always learning' and humble personalities. We welcome everyone to apply if you feel it suits you and let’s have a chat to see if you could be right for the role.

title: Integrations Product Manager
description:
Pleo is the spending solution for forward-thinking teams 💪
   

  

 We empower employees of thousands of companies through smart virtual and physical cards and a modern expense management app 🙏
   

  

 Cash is old school. We want every employee to feel valued and trusted when spending company money. After all, if you're trusted enough to be hired, you should be trusted enough to spend money responsibly!
   

  

 We are now looking for a new star to come in and help us build and grow our
 **New Growth Partnerships Team 🚀**
 We are a fairly new team - and we are looking for someone equally motivated who wants to make their mark, help us shape things, and have a sizeable impact on the growth of Pleo. If this gets you excited, please keep reading!
   

  

 But let us introduce you to the domain this role will be part of 💪
   

  

 The
 **Partnerships Domain** 
 ensures the seamless availability of Pleo across the software and service ecosystem, through the creation of high-impact distribution partnerships and powerful product integrations.
   

  

 As part of the
 **New Growth Partnerships Team** 
 , you will be directly responsible for growing and expanding Pleo’s technical integration capabilities, by building integrations with Europe’s most commonly used and loved SaaS providers, including accounting software, HR software, Payroll systems, Project Management systems, and merchants. The creation of these integrations is a key component of Pleo’s long-term strategy to become a key ecosystem player.
   

  

**What Is Expected In The Role... 💡**
* Find and engage with partners to build integrations with Pleo, and manage incoming requests from partners wanting to build and publish a Pleo integration
* Support partners to understand the Pleo product and how to build an integration, answering questions about Pleo, the APIs, and publishing processes
* Partner with Sales, Customer Success, Support, Product, Engineering, and partners to advocate for integration development in line with customer needs
* Manage partners and help them through the process of designing, building, and publishing an integration/ application. Help to design and safeguard the user experience of integrations being built and published, and as always, act as a main point of contact about the Pleo product and Pleo APIs
* Support internal teams in designing building, and publishing integrations between Pleo and other products
* Request, feedback on, and validate partner proposals, including commercial, product, UX, and technical aspects
* Be the primary interface and single point of contact between a partner and Pleo, and coordinate contact with different teams and people throughout Pleo
* Work with product teams and drive product improvements by collecting product and API feedback from partners and customers
* Continuously improve playbooks, processes, technical and process documentation, and experience, to improve the overall experience for external developers, and ultimately lower the Pleo partner time and effort needed for an integration
* Manage the coordination and success of go-live for integrations, and ensure value from integrations through internal (Sales, CX, CS) enablement. Continuously improve playbooks and processes to streamline the launch of, and maximize, the impact from new integrations
* Become a subject matter expert in how Pleo best integrates with other types of software, and, on all existing and new integrations.


**What Great Looks Like ⭐️**
* Experience in driving the process of defining, building, and launching integrations with partners and internal teams, from start to value
* Knows what it takes to effectively manage relationships with partners, whilst supporting them in the process
* Holds experience in managing the technical and delivery aspects of 3rd party integrations, whilst aligning closely with support and product development teams where needed
* Possesses the ability to work cross-functionally across commercial and product development functions, being able to find support when blocked, and gain important insights to maximise value
* Has the ability to evaluate, negotiate, and agree on partner agreements that are commercially viable for Pleo
* Possesses great attention to detail, and the ability to read documentation in order to guide partners in how best to integrate Pleo with other products from user experience and data mapping perspectives
* The willingness to learn and become fluent in the Pleo product and APIs
* Possesses strong project management and time management skills
* Holds the ability to work as an individual contributor with minimal supervision
* Knows how to anticipate customer needs in the context of the Pleo product and champion the customer


**Nice to haves 📋**
* Hold experience working with integrations in the accounting/ ERP and IDP/ HRIS space
* Knows what it takes to work with partners to build integrations and apps for SaaS customers
* Possess experience working in SaaS and financial or accounting services
* Experience in outlining user flows and creating wireframe designs


**Your colleagues say you 👇**
* Are structured and have an eye for detail, always putting the customer first
* Are proactive and have a strong sense of ownership and drive
* Are adaptable and open to finding new ways of problem-solving


**Show me the benefits! 🥁**
* Your own Pleo card (no more out-of-pocket spending!)
* Lunch is on us - with catering in our Lisbon, Copenhagen and London offices or a monthly lunch allowance paid directly together with your salary in other markets 🍜
* Private health insurance to ensure you’re fit in body and mind to do your best work
* For our Partnerships team we offer flexible and remote working
* Option to purchase 5 additional days of holiday through a salary sacrifice
* Access to LinkedIn Learning - acquire new skills, stay abreast of industry trends and fuel your personal and professional development continuously
* Paid parental leave - we want to make sure that we're supportive of families and help you feel that you don't have to compromise your family due to work 👶


**Why join us?**
 Working at Pleo means you're working on something very exciting: the future of work. Our mission is to help every company go beyond the books. Pleo itself means ‘more than you’d expect’, and it’s been the secret to our success over the last 8 years. So it’s only fitting that we’d pass this philosophy onto our customers to help them make the most of their finances.
   

  

 We think company spending should be delegated to all employees and teams, that it should be as automated as possible, and that it should drive a culture of responsible spending. Finance teams shouldn’t be siloed from the rest of the organisation – they should work in unity with marketing, sales, IT and everyone else.
   

  

 Speaking of working in unity, our values tell the story of how we work at Pleo. We have four core values, the first of which is ‘champion the customer’, which means we address real pain points that businesses face. Next up is ‘succeed as a team’, which highlights how our strength lies in our diversity and trust in each other. We also ‘make it happen’ by taking bold decisions and following through to deliver results. Last but not least, we ‘build to scale’, creating lasting solutions that address today’s challenges and anticipate tomorrow’s needs.
   

  

 So, in a nutshell, that's Pleo. Today we are a 850+ team, from over 100 nations, sitting in our Copenhagen HQ, London, Stockholm, Berlin, Madrid, Montreal and Lisbon offices —and quite a few full-time remotes in 35 other countries! Being HQ'd out of Copenhagen means we're inspired by things like a good work-life balance. If you don't work in the office with us, we'll help you set up the best remote setup possible
 *and* 
 make sure you still have time to connect with your team.
   

  

**About Your Application**
* Please submit your application in English; it’s our company language so you’ll be speaking lots of it if you join 💕
* We treat all candidates equally: If you are interested please apply through our application system - any correspondence should come from there! Our lovely support isn't able to pass on any calls/ emails our way - and this makes sure that the candidate experience is smooth and fair to everyone 😊
* We’re on a mission to make everyone feel valued at work. That’s only achievable if our team reflects the diversity of the world around us - and that starts with you, hitting apply, even if you are worried you might not tick all the boxes! We embrace and encourage people from all backgrounds to apply - regardless of race/ethnicity, colour, religion, nationality, gender, sex, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, neurodiversity, socio-economic status, culture or beliefs
* When you submit an application we process your personal data as a data processor. Find out more about how your data is used in the FAQs section at the bottom of our jobs page

title: Senior Product Manager (Bangkok-based)
description:
**About Agoda**
 Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with a global network of 4.7M hotels and holiday properties worldwide, plus flights, activities, and more . Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 7,100+ employees representing 95+ nationalities in 27 markets foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.
   

  

**Our Purpose –** 
**Bridging the World Through Travel**
 We believe travel allows people to enjoy, learn and experience more of the amazing world we live in. It brings individuals and cultures closer together, fostering empathy, understanding and happiness.
   

  

 We are a skillful, driven and diverse team from across the globe, united by a passion to make an impact. Harnessing our innovative technologies and strong partnerships, we aim to make travel easy and rewarding for everyone.
   

  

**Get to know our team:**
 In Product, ideas come alive. The world is moving fast so our culture empowers ownership and minimal bureaucracy. That’s the environment that enables you to do what you think is right – and quickly. Our Product Managers move fast, fail, learn, and pivot.
   

  

 Being a product-centric organization, our team works cross-functionally to build products from conception to launch by bringing together engineering and business worlds. Agoda Product Managers work closely with executive leadership and have high visibility among the C-suite; they have direct impact on Agoda’s growth and strategy. Product puts our travelers first and delivers that special travel experience in the most creative expression.
   

  

**The opportunity:**
 This role is
 **BANGKOK-BASED, RELOCATION PROVIDED.** 
 Our Senior Product Managers are analytical and data-driven individuals, who’re responsible for building products end-to-end focusing on analyzing and experimenting until our solutions are perfectly tailored to our travelers. As our next Senior Product Manager, you will drive product strategy and partner closely with senior leadership cross-functionally to define, build, and deliver the best travel solutions.
   

  

 You will get dedicated engineering resources that you, and only you define and allocate. We expect you to have a hands-on mentality and spend considerable time with your SCRUM teams, have enthusiasm to develop engineered processes and technologies and apply innovative solutions to make organizational improvements. Product Managers can modify \*every\* system we have in our company to suit their needs.
   

  

 By applying to this role, you’ll be considered for a role either in User Experience, Marketing, Finance or Supply product vertical. The goal is to match you with the team that best aligns with your interests, competencies, and where you will have the most impact. We’re looking for Senior Product Managers for every part of our business. Our entire Product team sits in Bangkok. This is an Individual Contributor position.
   

  

**In this role, you’ll get to:**
* Analyze the online travel ecosystem, markets, competitive landscape and user requirements
* Conceptualize, launch and optimize products and features, experiment, test their performance and iterate quickly
* Work collaboratively with Engineering, Marketing, Legal and UX teams on cutting-edge technologies
* Develop innovative solutions to some of the world’s difficult problems by collaborating as needed across regions, product areas, and functions


**What you’ll need to succeed:**
* Bachelor’s degree in technical field (i.e. Computer Science, Statistics, Engineering, Mathematics, or similar quantitative discipline)
* Proven ability to leverage analytics and quantitative methods to inform and influence decision-making
* Strong data skills
* Excellent communication skills (both verbal and written in English) with proven ability to convey complex messages clearly and with conviction to different stakeholders
* Experience developing and launching products
* Experience leading global product vision, go-to-market strategy and design discussions
* Entrepreneurial and analytical skills; effective at breaking down complex problems and driving and managing change
* Hands-on mentality


**It’s great if you have:**
* MBA or Master’s degree in Math, Economics, Computer Science or Statistics
* Data tools – SQL, Python, R, or equivalent


 #seattle #sanfrancisco #beijing #newyork #london #bangkok #singapore #chicago #hongkong #singapore #berlin #shanghai #losangeles #boston #austin #toronto #luxembourg #munich #oslo #copenhagen #stockholm #helsinki #brussels #hamburg #stuttgart #taipei #hamburg #stuttgart #dublin #telaviv #sydney #melbourne #perth #vancouver #montreal #prague #paris #dublin #telaviv #milan #rome #tokyo #osaka #amsterdam #moscow #saintpetersburg #frankfurt #shenzhen #istanbul #dubai #kiev #seoul
   

  

**Equal Opportunity Employer**
 At Agoda, we pride ourselves on being a company represented by people of all different backgrounds and orientations. We prioritize attracting diverse talent and cultivating an inclusive environment that encourages collaboration and innovation. Employment at Agoda is based solely on a person’s merit and qualifications. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity regardless of sex, age, race, color, national origin, religion, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, citizenship, veteran or military status, and other legally protected characteristics.
   

  

 We will keep your application on file so that we can consider you for future vacancies and you can always ask to have your details removed from the file. For more details please read our privacy policy .
   

  

 To all recruitment agencies: Agoda does not accept third party resumes. Please do not send resumes to our jobs alias, Agoda employees or any other organization location. Agoda is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

title: Senior Testledare
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.
   

  

**Jobbeskrivning**
* Planera, leda och följa upp aktiviteter för test och kvalitetssäkring av IT-system.
* Utföra tester av IT-system och andra kvalitetssäkringsaktiviteter.
* Följa upp testers och kvalitetssäkringens utfall och driva frågor om defekter mot utvecklare samt interna och externa leverantörer
* Planera utvecklings- och kvalitetssäkringsaktiviteter tillsammans med projektledare, kravledare, UX:are, leverantörer, produktägare och användare.
* Dokumentera relevant information om testplan, testfall, defekter och rapporter.
* Stödja beställare med planering och utförande av acceptanstester.
* Utbilda och coacha våra egna testare med både testledning och testning för kvalitetssäkring av IT-system.
* Bidra till utvecklingen av vår förmåga att leda och utföra tester genom att ta fram modeller och metoder samt att coacha anställda.


**Din profil (Skall krav)**
* Minst 5 års arbetslivserfarenhet i rollen som testledare för förvaltnings- eller utvecklingsuppdrag inom IT inom de senaste 10 åren.
* Minst 5 års arbetslivserfarenhet av att utföra manuella tester av IT-system inom de senaste 10 åren.
* Minst 2 års arbetslivserfarenhet av att planera och leda tester av IT-leveranser från externa leverantörer inom de senaste 10 åren.
* Minst 3 års arbetslivserfarenhet av att använda adekvat digitalt verktyg som stöd för testledning och tester inom de senaste 10 åren.
* Mycket god förmåga att samarbeta med interna och externa intressenter
* Mycket god förmåga att utrycka sig i tal och skrift på svenska eller engelska.


**Meriterande**
* Minst 2 års arbetslivserfarenhet av testledning eller operativ testning av system för budgetering i Ekonomi-domänen inom de senaste 10 åren.
* Minst 2 års arbetslivserfarenhet av tester av integrationer inom de senaste 10 åren.
* Minst 2 års arbetslivserfarenhet av kravledning eller kravanalys inom de senaste 10 åren.
* Minst 2 års arbetslivserfarenhet av utveckling av automatiska tester inom de senaste 10 åren.


**Sista ansökningdatum:** 
 02-12-2024
   

  

**Om Deploja**
 Vi sysselsätter idag erfarna konsulter, inom bl.a. Systemutveckling, Test, Arkitektur, IT-Projektledning, IT-Säkerhet.
   

  

 Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?
   

  

 Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Välkommen till Deploja, där gräset faktiskt är grönare!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.
   

  

 🌟 En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.
   

  

 🚗 Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.
   

  

 💼 Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.
   

  

 🌴 Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?
   

  

 🏥 Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.
   

  

 📚 Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.
   

  

 🕑 Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?
   

  

* Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.

title: Front End Web Developer - Västerås, Västmanlands län, Sweden
description:
**🚀 Join Our Team VIPAS AB as a Front End Web Developer** 
**🚀**
**Location:** 
**Västerås, Västmanlands län, Sweden**
**Do you have what it takes to thrive in the vibrant world of IT consulting? VIPAS AB, a burgeoning company, proudly invites you to embark on your next engaging project as our Front End Web Developer**
**About VIPAS :**
 Imagine a world where your business technology perfectly aligns with your goals—efficient, scalable, and innovative. At VIPAS AB, that’s exactly what we strive to create. As an IT consulting company, we don’t just offer services; we deliver tailored solutions using cutting-edge technologies like Java and Python. Our team is well-versed in software development, DevOps, and engineering, bringing years of experience and expertise. Think of us as your trusted guide, leading your organization through the landscape of modern tech adoption, ensuring every step is taken with confidence and foresight.
   

  

**Job Description:**
 VIPAS AB is seeking a skilled Senior Front-End Developer to join our team and lead the development of next-generation HMI solutions for Substation Power Quality Applications. In this role, you will collaborate with design teams to create, test, and implement innovative HMI systems within MicroSCADA X. Your expertise in front-end web development, UX design, and power systems will be crucial as you work in an agile environment to deliver high-quality solutions for critical infrastructure projects.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Develop next-generation HMI solutions for Power Quality (PQ) Control and Protection Systems at the substation level.
* Collaborate with the UX/UI conceptual design team to create innovative Substation HMI solutions in MicroSCADA X.
* Test, debug, and optimize Substation HMI solutions to ensure peak performance.
* Train and support teams in implementing HMI solutions for delivery projects.
* Contribute to agile teams by developing new features and applications to enhance service offerings.
* Engage with diverse stakeholders to understand requirements and ensure successful project outcomes.
* Uphold core values of safety and integrity through accountability and fostering a supportive team environment.


**Requirements:** 
  

  

* Education: A university degree in a relevant technical field.
* Experience:
+ Proven experience as a Web/HMI Front-End Developer.
+ Hands-on experience with HTML/XML markup languages.
+ Proficiency in JavaScript and HTML5.
+ Experience with HMI conceptual design, especially within Substation and/or Power Systems.
+ Familiarity with testing and debugging HMI solutions.
+ Comprehensive understanding of the full web development process (design, development, deployment).
+ Experience with MicroSCADA X HMI development and SCIL programming is a strong advantage.

* Skills:
+ Excellent problem-solving skills and proactive initiative.
+ Demonstrated ability to work in agile environments (SCRUM, lean methodologies).
+ Strong collaboration skills, with a focus on continuous improvement and delivering results.
+ Fluent in English


**Why Join Us?**
 Vipas AB offers attractive employment packages for IT consultants, aligned with the Teknikföretagen (Almega) collective agreement. Clients Working with us provides opportunities in diverse industries, allowing you flexibility and growth. If you’re driven and eager to face new challenges, join the VIPAS family.
   

  

 You'll be part of an innovative team driving the future of telecom, Automotive, Retail, and Banking. If you're ready to take on challenging projects and grow your career in a cutting-edge environment, this is the opportunity for you!
   

  

**Apply Now & Please feel free to reach me at sandhya@vipas.se**
**Note: Please do apply if you have Sweden PR/ citizenship OR a Sweden work permit.**
**How to Apply:**
 Interested candidates are encouraged to apply by submitting their resume and cover letter. Join us in driving innovation in the VIPAS AB!
   

  

 Please note! We offer continuously. That means that we sometimes remove the assignments before the deadline. If you are interested we recommend that you apply immediately.

title: Android Developer
description:
Marshall Group is the audio, tech, and design powerhouse uniting musicians and music lovers through genre-breaking innovation. Our flagship brand, Marshall, is uniquely positioned with over 60 years of rock ‘n’ roll attitude on stage, at home, and on the go. Our iconic products are brought to life by a dedicated team of 800 passionate employees and sold in over 90 markets worldwide.
 



  





**Right now,** 
 we need to strengthen our Software team with a Android developer that will be working with our cross-functional teams. The world of audio is changing. Smart speakers and True Wireless headphones are turning audio into a high-tech industry. In the last few years, our products have gone from simple wired devices to connected and complex IoT devices. We are now focusing on evolving our mobile app and the added value it can provide to our users.
 



  





**What you’ll do:** 




  




* Maintain and develop Android mobile apps for the Marshall brands
* Collaborate closely with our UX and Design team to discuss new features and functions.
* Support and participate in testing activities and evaluation of the app.
* Participate in knowledge-sharing sessions to promote new ideas and innovation.
* Teamwork with the other developers to help us brainstorm solutions and make our apps even better for our users.
* Prototyping new ideas to make them come true, both individually and across teams.



  





**Who we’re looking for:** 




 You are an Android developer with a collaborative mindset who cooperates well internally and externally. To succeed in this role, you need to be committed to collaborative problem-solving, and build quality products to create great user experiences together with the UX and design team. We believe you have a great passion for new technologies, trends, and software development. You get excited by the idea of creating an amazing app experience that resonates with people not only on a functional level but also on an emotional level.
 



  





**You probably have the following experiences & skills:** 




  




* + 2 years of proven professional Android app development experience.
* Experience working with Kotlin.
* Proficient in modern android design patterns (for ex. MVVM, dependency injection) and Jetpack components.
* Familiarity with coroutines and Compose, Dagger Hilt and Clean Architecture.
* Good understanding of Firebase & REST etc.
* Hence strong written and spoken English skills are essential.
* Experience with Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) is a plus.



  





**Our pledge:** 




 We thrive to foster an inclusive workplace and we do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, disability, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age or marital status. We firmly believe that Marshall thrives when our employees do, leading to better experiences for our consumers.
 



  





 We encourage applications from all over the world. To enable transitioning from another country for a role at Marshall, we offer re-location support. This support is tailored for each role but always includes visa/work permit application, local authority registration, and home finding service. Don't hesitate to reach out if you have any questions.
 



  





**Does this sound like you?** 




 We look forward to reviewing your application!

title: Principal Engineer
company_industry: Software Development, Computer and Network Security, and Information Technology & Services
description:
Flexera saves customers billions of dollars in wasted technology spend. A pioneer in Hybrid ITAM and FinOps, Flexera provides award-winning, data-oriented SaaS solutions for technology value optimization (TVO), enabling IT, finance, procurement and cloud teams to gain deep insights into cost optimization, compliance and risks for each business service. Flexera One solutions are built on a set of definitive customer, supplier and industry data, powered by our Technology Intelligence Platform, that enables organizations to visualize their Enterprise Technology Blueprint™ in hybrid environments—from on-premises to SaaS to containers to cloud.
   

  

 We’re transforming the software industry.  We’re Flexera.  With
 **more than 50,000 customers** 
 across the world, we’re achieving that goal. But we know we can’t do any of that without our team. Ready to help us re-imagine the industry during a time of substantial growth and ambitious plans?  Come and see why
 **we’re consistently recognized by Gartner, Forrester and IDC** 
 as a category leader in the marketplace. Learn more at
 **flexera.com**
**Principal Software Engineer**
 As a Principal Software Engineer at Flexera, you will play a crucial role in setting the technical direction and architecture for our cutting-edge SaaS Management product.
   

  

 Your work will span the entire spectrum of activities required to run a high-performance cloud solution, guiding multiple teams and partner with engineers to develop innovative solutions to complex issues. You will promote best practices across the team and will act as quality expert ensuring our solutions are scalable, secure, and performant. As part of the architecture council, you will help evolve and implement the architectural direction and strategies within Flexera and be a key player that will allow us to deliver on our functional and non-functional requirements for years to come.
   

  

 While much of our work is done remotely, we value the ability to connect face-to-face for high value collaboration activities. As such, our ideal candidate will be based in Stockholm, Sweden.
   

  

**What You'll Do:** 
  

  

* Actively participate in an agile software development life cycle, including decomposing requirements, documenting and discussing the design, estimation, and implementation.
* Design and implement cloud-based, multi-layered software applications with a strong focus on scalability, performance, and security. Lead the technical roadmap for the SaaS Manager product line.
* Prototype new solutions, contribute to code reviews and analysis of issues, primarily in Go in Kubernetes in Azure.
* Collaborate with Chief Architect, Principal and Lead engineers, and product management to develop technology strategy and architecture for current and future products
* Lead and participate in architecture discussions, generating recommendations that align with the business goals and technology strategy.
* Engage in rapid prototyping and pair programming to validate concepts and refine solutions.
* Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including product managers, UX designers and Cloud Operations, to translate requirements into scalable solutions.
* Constantly improve product quality, security, and performance by leveraging the latest deployment and monitoring tools such as ArgoCD, SumoLogic, SonarQube, PagerDuty
* Provide mentorship and technical leadership to the engineering team, fostering a culture of continuous learning and innovation.
* Collaborate with teams to create and review architecture and design proposals including functional and non-functional requirements.


**You'll Be Expected to Have:** 
  

  

* Extensive experience in developing complex, cloud-based applications, and can show us your personal/work projects. - Extensive experience with a functional or object-oriented language (Go, C#, Java)
* Ability to reason about software, algorithms, and performance from a high level
* Experience designing and delivering cloud native, microservices based applications and cloud-native solutions, including experience with Kubernetes, Docker, and Terraform.
* Strong proficiency in storage technologies, including MongoDB, Cloud Object storage and RDBMS.
* Superb communication skills to work effectively within and across teams, including mentoring and guiding junior engineers.
* Experience with following is a plus: JavaScript, React, stream processing, AWS
* Experience providing technical leadership across one or more teams
* Strong understanding of agile ways of working and systems thinking


 Sounds good? Join us and collaborate with very talented and passionate colleagues to push the boundaries of cloud computing. Feel free to include examples of your work or your GitHub profile.
   

  

**#Development**
 Flexera is proud to be an equal opportunity employer.  Qualified applicants will be considered for open roles regardless of age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by local/national laws, policies and/or regulations.
   

  

 Flexera understands the value that results from employing a diverse, equitable, and inclusive workforce. We recognize that equity necessitates acknowledging past exclusion and that inclusion requires intentional effort. Our DEI (Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion) council is the driving force behind our commitment to championing policies and practices that foster a welcoming environment for all.
   

  

 We encourage candidates requiring accommodations to please let us know by emailing careers@flexera.com.

title: HVDC Control & Protection Software Engineer
description:
**Description**


**The opportunity**


Do you want to enable green energy transition, and together with colleagues build customized embedded control and protection systems consisting of both software and hardware to meet our customers' and the world's needs for a sustainable, flexible, and secure energy future?


We are convinced that HVDC (High Voltage Direct Current) technology, solutions for energy transfer with direct current at high voltages, is a long-term sustainable solution. The technology is used for energy transmission over long distances and to connect electricity networks with minimal losses. In addition to energy transfer, HVDC technology also alleviates electricity quality problems and can contribute to the stabilization of connected power grids. For offshore wind power or long-distance underwater transmissions, direct current is the only realistic energy transmission alternative.


In this role as a Software Design Engineer at Hitachi Energy you will be a part of a Global HVDC Control & Protection Software team. Our team is responsible for **System Supervision & Communication**, we have interfaces towards other domains within Control & Protection, IT/OT, Hardware and Operations.


The need for expertise in our area is increasing and we are therefore looking for both freshly graduated students and senior engineers to join our team!

**How you´ll make an impact**

* To be part of all phases of delivery, which includes design, maintenance, testing, integration, verification, and deployment of the software functions needed for safe and reliable operations of plants and transmission links, with the opportunity to also travel internationally for short assignments to our sites for Commissioning and costumer meetings.
* To work with documentation and customer trainings.
* To have a sense of responsibility and ownership, being capable of planning and organizing your daily work.
* To be a problem solver who takes initiatives to solve challenges together with stakeholders.
* You are living Hitachi Energy´s core values of safety and integrity, which means taking responsibility for your own actions while caring for your colleagues and the business.

**Your background**

* You hold a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree within a relevant field, such as Electrical Engineering, Power Systems, High Voltage, Software Engineering, Computer Engineering.
* You have work proficiency in English, both written and spoken. Additional languages, such as Swedish are an advantage.
* You have an interest or experience within software development and programming.
* You have an interest or experience in digital control technology, signal processing and filtering.
* You have an interest or experience from the electric power industry.

**What we offer**

* Collective agreement
* Flexible working time
* Health care and wellness allowance
* Fantastic career possibilities within Hitachi Energy both within Sweden and globally
* Mentor to support you throughout onboard phase
* Various trainings and education supporting employee development
* Diversified company with over 70+ nationalities working in Sweden
* Supplementary compensation for parental leave
* Employee Benefit Portal with thousands of discounts and perks

**More about us**


Join Hitachi Energy and work in a team that is dedicated to creating a future where innovative digital technologies allow greater access to cleaner energy. We offer you an exciting and stimulating work environment, where you become an important team player collaborating to deliver our world-class technology and developing the best HVDC Control & Protection for our customers. We value you as a person and believe in personal development. Please apply today, even if you do not meet all the criteria above. Our selection process is continuous, and the position may be closed before the advertisement expires, so don’t delay – apply no later than 30th of January 2025!

**Recruiting Manager Elmira Birkehag**, elmira.birkehag@hitachienergy.com, will be happy to answer your questions regarding this position. Union representatives - Sveriges Ingenjörer; Mikael Hjort, + 46 107-38 29 86; Ledarna: Frank Hollstedt, +46 107-38 70 43; Unionen: Fredrik Holmgren, +46 107-38 21 85. All other questions should be directed to Talent Partner Håkan Kempel, hakan.kempel@hitachienergy.com
company_description: Advancing a sustainable energy future for all

title: Cloud Data Engineer
description:
